summary: Gene R. Johnson was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). His name appears on multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from April 1978 to January 1979. These documents list his name, salary, and employment dates within the committee. The documents suggest he was a staff member during a significant period of the SCAS's investigation.
significance: Gene R. Johnson's significance lies in his employment within the Select Committee on Assassinations. While the specific nature of his role is not detailed in these documents, his presence on payroll records indicates his involvement in the committee's operations during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
